# SNAP Protocol

> Signed Network Agent Protocol â€” decentralized agent-to-agent communication with Bitcoin P2TR identity and BIP-340 Schnorr authentication.

## Documentation

- [Concepts](docs/concepts.md): Core protocol concepts and architecture
- [Messages](docs/messages.md): Message format, types, and methods
- [Authentication](docs/authentication.md): BIP-340 Schnorr signatures and identity verification
- [Agent Card](docs/agent-card.md): Agent capability discovery and publication
- [Transport](docs/transport.md): HTTP, WebSocket, and Nostr transport layers
- [Constraints](docs/constraints.md): Field validation rules and size limits
- [Errors](docs/errors.md): Error codes (1xxx-5xxx) and retry logic
- [Discovery](docs/discovery.md): Finding agents via Nostr and HTTP well-known
- [Security Practices](docs/security-practices.md): Security model and best practices
- [Tutorial](docs/tutorial.md): Step-by-step guide to building SNAP agents
- [Implementation Guide](docs/implementation-guide.md): Building an SDK from scratch
- [Use Cases](docs/use-cases.md): Real-world application scenarios
- [Design Decisions](docs/design-decisions.md): Why SNAP chose its approach (vs mTLS, JWT, DID, etc.)
- [FAQ](docs/faq.md): Frequently asked questions
- [Versioning](docs/versioning.md): Protocol version policy

## SDK

- [TypeScript SDK (@snap-protocol/core)](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@snap-protocol/core)

## Source

- [GitHub](https://github.com/WilliamPenrose/snap-protocol)
